trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning provides specialized tools for helping you work with both structured and unstructured text:
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning provides specialized tools for helping you work with both structured and unstructured text:

trans-unit.source: Feature hashing helps you efficiently extract features from text without requiring additional preprocessing or advanced linguistic analysis
trans-unit.target: Feature hashing helps you efficiently extract features from text without requiring additional preprocessing or advanced linguistic analysis

trans-unit.source: The Vowpal Wabbit libraries support very fast text analytics using advanced feature hashing techniques
trans-unit.target: The Vowpal Wabbit libraries support very fast text analytics using advanced feature hashing techniques

trans-unit.source: Named entity recognition is provided to help you easily extract the names of people, places, and organizations from unstructured text
trans-unit.target: Named entity recognition is provided to help you easily extract the names of people, places, and organizations from unstructured text

trans-unit.source: For examples of text analytics using Azure Machine Learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of text analytics using Azure Machine Learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses feature hashing to classify articles into a predefined list of categories.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>News Categorization</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525167</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses feature hashing to classify articles into a predefined list of categories.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Find similar companies</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525164</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the text of Wikipedia articles to categorize companies.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Find similar companies</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525164</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the text of Wikipedia articles to categorize companies.

trans-unit.source: In the five-part <externalLink><linkText>Text Classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525957</linkUri></externalLink> sample, text from Twitter messages is used to perform sentiment analysis.
trans-unit.target: In the five-part <externalLink><linkText>Text Classification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525957</linkUri></externalLink> sample, text from Twitter messages is used to perform sentiment analysis.

trans-unit.source: The Modules References.Text Analytics category includes the following modules:
trans-unit.target: The Modules References.Text Analytics category includes the following modules:

trans-unit.source: Converts text data to integer-encoded features using the Vowpal Wabbit library
trans-unit.target: Converts text data to integer-encoded features using the Vowpal Wabbit library

trans-unit.source: Recognizes named entities in a text column
trans-unit.target: Recognizes named entities in a text column

trans-unit.source: Scores data using the Vowpal Wabbit machine learning system
trans-unit.target: Scores data using the Vowpal Wabbit machine learning system

trans-unit.source: Trains a model from the Vowpal Wabbit machine learning system
trans-unit.target: Trains a model from the Vowpal Wabbit machine learning system
